[[Kœtzingue]]

CATEGORIES: Communes in Haut-Rhin

Kœtzingue is a commune in the Haut-Rhin department in the east of France.

[[Alternate ending]]

CATEGORIES: Movie industry

Alternate ending is a term used (usually in movies) to describe the ending of a story that was planned or debated but ultimately unused in favor of the actual ending. Generally, alternative endings are considered to have no bearing on the canonical narrative. On the internet, amateurs may make their own alternative endings.

[[Timothy F. Murphy]]

CATEGORIES: 1952 births, Living people, United States representatives from Pennsylvania, Politicians from Cleveland, Ohio, US Republican Party politicians

Timothy Francis Murphy (born September 11, 1952) was the U.S. Representative for PA, serving from 2003 until his resignation in October 2017. He is a member of the Republican Party. He previously served in the Pennsylvania Senate. He is a commander in the United States Navy Reserve.

In October 2017, Murphy announced that he would not seek re-election in 2018 due to revelations that during an affair he had urged his mistress to have an abortion despite his public anti-abortion stance. On October 5, House Speaker Paul Ryan’s Office announced Murphy would step down on October 21.

[[Rob Quist]]

CATEGORIES: 1948 births, Living people, American singer-songwriters, American guitarists, American progressives, Politicians from Montana, Writers from Montana, Singers from Montana, Musicians from Montana, US Democratic Party politicians

Robert Ernest Quist (born January 5, 1948) is an American singer, instrumentalist (playing guitar and banjo), songwriter, and politician. 

His songs have been recorded by artists Michael Martin Murphey and Loretta Lynn among others.  He is known as a musical and cultural ambassador for the state of Montana and was appointed to the Montana Arts Council by Governor Brian Schweitzer. He has toured  throughout the United States, Canada, and Japan. 

Quist was the Democratic nominee for Montana's House seat in the 2017 special election, but lost the election to Greg Gianforte.

[[Lance Russell]]

CATEGORIES: 1926 births, 2017 deaths, Deaths from fractured hip, Accidental deaths from falls in the United States, Sportspeople from Tennessee

Lance Russell (March 18, 1926 – October 3, 2017) was a professional wrestling announcer and commentator from 1959 to 1997. He was born in Tennessee.

His primary announcing partner was Dave Brown. He was included in the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA)'s Hall of Fame and Hall of Heroes. 

In addition, he was in the United States Wrestling Association's Memphis Wrestling Hall of Fame and Wrestling Observer Newsletter's Hall of Fame.

Russell died in Memphis, Tennessee on October 3, 2017 from complications of a broken hip caused by a fall at the age of 91.

[[Alvin Ailey]]

CATEGORIES: American choreographers, LGBT African Americans, 1931 births, 1989 deaths, LGBT people from Texas

Alvin Ailey (5 January 1931 – 1 December 1989) was an American ballet dancer and choreographer. He was born in Rogers, Texas.

[[Beverly Grove, Los Angeles]]

CATEGORIES: Neighborhoods of Los Angeles

Beverly Grove is a small neighborhood  in the central region of the City of Los Angeles, California.

The neighborhood has an area of 1.65-square-miles. As of 2000, about 21,000 people lived there. The ZIP codes for Beverly Grove are 90046 and 90048.

[[Giorgio Pressburger]]

CATEGORIES: 1937 births, 2017 deaths, Italian writers, Hungarian novelists, People from Budapest

Giorgio Pressburger (April 21, 1937 – October 5, 2017) was an Hungarian-born Italian writer of novels and short stories. He was born in Budapest.

Pressburger settled in Italy in 1956, where he worked as a movie and theatre director. He later became the Director of the Institute of Italian Culture in Hungary.

His book The Law of White Spaces was shortlisted for the Independent Foreign Fiction Award in 1992. His other works include the novel Teeth and Spies and the short story collection Snow and Guilt.
